meanings.definition: To refresh oneself, as by eating or drinking.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, I enjoy refecting on a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: She refects with a cup of tea every evening to relax.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be refecting on the tasty fish it had just eaten.
meanings.sent4: The garden refected the care and attention the gardener had put into it.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was refecting throughout the house.

meanings.definition: To take refreshment, especially food or drink.
meanings.sent1: During the break, the workers were refecting on sandwiches and juice.
meanings.sent2: The hikers refected on the cool water from the stream.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was a perfect time for refecting on delicious treats.
meanings.sent4: The party guests refected on the tasty appetizers provided.
meanings.sent5: The athletes refected on energy bars to regain their strength.

meanings.definition: To provide food or drink for someone.
meanings.sent1: The host was refecting the guests with a variety of snacks.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant refected the hungry customers with a hearty meal.
meanings.sent3: The kind neighbor refected the tired workers with cold drinks.
meanings.sent4: The charity organization refected the homeless with warm meals.
meanings.sent5: The school cafeteria refected the students with nutritious lunches.
